title: Sion getting nerfed and Irelia stays the same
body: Perfect balance. A tank who is able to have a decent laning phase is a problem I see. Meanwhile Irelia who can't tank as much as sion, but for sure do WAY more damage and is actually able to kill your carries alone can stay the same.

It's less a nerf and more of a power shift.

With Sion's Roar of the Slayer, you get some really long-ranged poke. If you max it first, your poke is extremely strong, even when building full tank, and your poke is super safe.

This wouldn't normally be a problem, except for the fact that it costs so little. 35 mana is way too little for how strong a poking tool it is, especially considering how deceiving its range can be when used through minions.

These factors give Sion an inappropriately strong early game for how strong his late game is, so the mana adjustment is there to keep his laning phase more in check, and expand on the weaknesses of bullying Sion early to delay his lategame power spike.

He's also getting the mana cost reduced on his Decimating Smash at later levels, which is a pretty good compensation buff. This improves his early game if he maxes it first without making his laning phase too oppressive to go against.

Also, don't forget the indirect buffs he's getting. The new Cinderhulk enchantment should be absolutely insane on jungle Sion.
